items.title: Today’s Scuttlebot: Tech Design Comics and Artificial Intelligence Money
items.abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Thursday, selections include Internet technologies spreading into more industries, which Web sites share what information and the latest iPhone bug.

items.title: I.B.M. Research Points to Circuits That Mimic the Brain’s Design
items.abstract: Researchers at the computer giant said Thursday that they had developed a fluidic electronic system that mimics the way the brain works.

items.title: Disruptions: How Driverless Cars Could Reshape Cities
items.abstract: While driverless cars might still seem like science fiction, people are considering what they could mean for the city of the future. The short answer is “a lot.”

items.title: New York City Casts a Net to Catch the Next Big Start-Up
items.abstract: A nonprofit, Tech:NYC, aims to make New York more appealing to start-ups, big tech companies and venture firms.

items.title: Technology Is Monitoring the Urban Landscape
items.abstract: Much technical change in American cities will involve monitoring, which can make life easier but poses troubling questions about privacy and control.

items.title: Learning With: ‘How China Turned a City Into a Prison’
items.abstract: The Chinese government is using high-tech mass surveillance to turn a city with an ethnic and Muslim minority into a virtual cage? Is this the future of technology?

items.title: A Fake Heiress Called Anna Delvey Conned the City’s Wealthy. ‘I’m Not Sorry,’ She Says.
items.abstract: Anna Sorokin was convicted by a Manhattan jury, but told The New York Times from jail that she did nothing wrong — and would do it all again.

items.title: San Francisco Bans Facial Recognition Technology
items.abstract: It is the first ban by a major city on the use of facial recognition technology by the police and all other municipal agencies.

items.title: I’m an Engineer, and I’m Not Buying Into ‘Smart’ Cities
items.abstract: Sensor-equipped garbage cans sound cool, but someone still has to take out the trash.

items.title: Sausalito Marin City Schools to Desegregate After State Inquiry
items.abstract: Monday: Also, Kamala Harris pivots to Iowa, and a former inmate runs to put San Quentin behind him.

items.title: Can Technology Help Cities Manage Curbs Better?
items.abstract: We’re asking our streets and sidewalks to do more and more. Start-ups are trying to help with curbside management tools — but will cities rise to the challenge?

items.title: Where Could a Casino Be Built in New York City? What We Know
items.abstract: Three gambling licenses for downstate New York are up for grabs. Here’s what has been proposed so far, where the casinos might be located and who gets to decide.
keywords: New York State Gaming Facility Location Board
